intro: Eriocaulon malaissei, commonly known as the Malay sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of white or pale green flowers. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. Eriocaulon malaissei is often found in shallow water or along the edges of ponds and streams.
